description.default: You stand in the vestibule of the Temple of Aethelion, facing the massive Dawn Gate. The floor is a mosaic sun-dial, time told by the shadow of a central eagle statue. To the west lies the city; to the east, the grand Nave of the Firstborn.

objects.name: bronze doors
objects.description: Massive doors of gilded bronze depicting a rising sun.

objects.name: sun-dial mosaic
objects.description: A complex floor mosaic. A shadow cast by the eagle statue indicates the time of day.

objects.name: eagle statue
objects.description: A bronze eagle with spread wings.

description.default: The main worship hall is bathed in light from a crystal dome overhead. Rows of polished white pews face a white marble altar. Behind it, a massive golden bowl—the Ever-Burning Brazier—holds a flame that never wavers. Staircases lead UP and DOWN.

objects.name: ever-burning brazier
objects.description: A massive golden bowl holding a magical, heatless flame representing eternal vigilance.

objects.name: white marble altar
objects.description: The center of worship, draped in cloth of gold.

objects.name: crystal dome
objects.description: A magnificent architectural feat that magnifies sunlight.

description.default: The smell of fresh bread and medicinal salves fills this room. Long tables are set up for food distribution, and cots line the walls for the sick. Frescoes of Aethelion healing the wounded adorn the walls.

objects.name: frescoes
objects.description: Paintings depicting the god Aethelion tending to wounded soldiers.

description.default: The air here is thick with frankincense. Wardrobes stand open, revealing white and gold vestments. A table holds various holy oils and censers.
A quiet gallery overlooking the Nave below. Sunlight streams in from the skylights. Doors lead north, south, and east.
The meeting room for the temple's militant wing. A round table of light-colored ash wood dominates the room, its surface carved with a tactical map of the region.

objects.name: round table
objects.description: The table surface is a relief map of the surrounding lands, marked with locations of known undead activity.

objects.name: Paladin Commander
objects.description: A stern warrior in plate armor polished to a mirror sheen.

description.default: The only sound here is the scratching of quills. Scribes hunch over desks copying holy texts. A large desk near the window features a peculiar mounted lens.

objects.name: lens of scrutiny
objects.description: A magical magnifying glass fixed to a desk. Looking through it reveals faint magical auras.

description.default: The private quarters of the High Priest. It is surprisingly modest, though it features a private balcony overlooking the Nave. The High Priest is usually found here.

objects.name: High Priest
objects.description: The High Priest of Aethelion, radiating a calm aura.

objects.name: balcony
objects.description: You can look down upon the worshippers in the Nave.

description.default: The air turns cool and still. The stone walls are unadorned. To the north lies the Crypt; to the south, a heavy iron vault door; to the east, a dark cell.
A silent chamber for past heroes. The sarcophagi here are not stone, but heavy glass, preserving the bodies inside in a state of perfect repose.

objects.name: glass sarcophagus
objects.description: Through the glass, the warrior inside looks as if they are merely sleeping.

description.default: A heavily fortified treasury. Gold and silver tithes are stacked here, but the centerpiece is a pedestal bathed in magical light, seemingly waiting for a weapon.

objects.name: stone pedestal
objects.description: A pedestal engraved with the warning: 'Only the worthy may touch, lest the False Dawn take them.'

description.default: A stark, windowless room. It is completely dark, save for a single tiny hole in the ceiling designed to let in a beam of light for exactly one hour at noon.

objects.name: tiny hole
objects.description: A masterwork of engineering, aligning with the sun only at its zenith.
